Dhruv, Manipur has got lots of communities but the meitei tribe has been dominant throughout its more than 2000 years documented history. Because they were in the valley they had the opportunity to lead a more organised life. There was peaceful co-existence earlier but the trouble started when India became independent and reservation started. The meiteis were categorised as general and the other tribes as ST. Dichotomy started from there as meiteis could not purchase property in hill areas and were now forced to stay only in the valley areas. But being the more educated and prosperous community, all infrastructure also became more concentrated in the valley. Hill tribes want to stay in the valley area but dont want to develop their hill areas. Blaming meiteis for their problems is their favourite pastime. As for the present violence, it was because the government cracked down on the poppy cultivation and illegal immigration in kuki dominated areas. Churachandpur district dominated by kukis, now is responsible for almost entire narcotics supply of India. What happened after the violence was started by the kukis on 3rd may is known to everybody. Now both communities are suffering. Here a major blame can be put on the central government, who has not controlled the violence till now. Perhaps they have a hidden agenda. But they seem content to just watch the two communuties fight.

Manipur is a beautiful state; but here people have been living  under  the pressure of corrupted leaders for a long time. There's a  huge bribery and  Corruption system going on since long;  especially in the job employments and in the govt contractor's work. Administrations in the state totally failed; no control and papers are kept pending for long; example- when an official is retired, his pension benefits will be kept pending for months or years until they're bribed.
Until & unless such kind of evils system are removed the  God's wrath will remain in the state and people will suffer &  hatred for one another. 
There will be no peace in Manipur, unless Politicians/ leaders &   controllers are aware of their own mistakes and come to the knowledge of the Almighty God.

Wow! I randomly came across this video and as a person from the Northeast part of India, i must say that the historical analysis and your thorough research for the Manipur Conflict is much more on point than any other national media outlets! No bias edition. The topography, the cross cultural connection and the historical factors in the Northeast is unique and complicated due to the British colonisation than majority of the other parts of India! That plays a critical role on the identity crisis for many of the people here, resulting in insurgency from various part of the community including both Kuki and Meiteis. It is understandable that majority of the Indians not residing in the Northeast might find it hard to understand the complexities here in the Northeast and which is why it is very important have a thorough research in order to understand the real situation there. 

Also for peace to restore in Manipur, i believe it is important to put aside the differences and come together with their shared similarities. This conflict cannot be resolved religiously, neither with a divisive political tactic or violently. At the end of the day we are all humans who needed each other.

It may seem so easy for any layman to say the economic gap between the hills and the valley is widely evident. But despite it being a government of any party, the issue is hard to resolve. 

Because, the representatives of the hills usurp all the funds earmarked for the development of the hilly region. These representatives donтАЩt even stay in their hill villages, except when its time for elections and they have to cajole the innocent civilians for a larger vote bank. 

The funds are embezzled and siphoned off by their MLAs to buy plots and properties in the imphal valley and other states of the country, and even abroad. 

When the hill villagers complain of no-development, their MLAs wrongly influence them saying no funds are sanctioned by the state. This is the same narrative used by their leaders to influence the gullible immigrants saying that everything will be fine once they get a separate administration. 

Its a very fragile camaraderie amongst the communities, which the meitei community at all time ushered the idea of unity in diversity. The meiteis were the arbitrators when the Naga-Kuki Conflict erupted in 1993. 

May be its the humbleness and welcoming attitude of the meiteis that has been misconceptualised by the kuki community as being meek. 

What do they get by disturbing the beautiful social fabric of the state? The gullible nature of the kuki community has been misused and misguided by their elite leaders and narco-terrorists to wage a war against the peace loving meitei civilians.. 

The only motive of the elite and narco-terrorist was to disguise the demand of ST by the meitei community as a trigger for the mayhem and genocide they waged upon the meiteis. And when the meiteis retaliate, they play the victim card on the lines of minority, religion and what not. 

The money earned from poppy cultivation and narco-terrorism is being used to influence the media-houses and even the EU parliament, who without any iota of the socio-economic-cultural ethos of Manipur, claimed their support for their christian brethen

Nice Try. Really appreciate the kind of research you did for this video. As a person from Manipur, I can say that you are around 80 - 85% correct. Not your fault though. Since there are very less reliable source about her history. Most of the historical records and books were burned by the edict of the then King Pamheiba, also known as Garibnawaz, 1690-1751 under the influence of a Bengali Hindu Missionary Shantidas Gosai, but that's a different story. So not just you or other people from outside of Manipur even we as a Manipuri don't know everything. So you did a good job. 
Now, the main reason for my comment is to make a correction. The three brothers 10:45,  the second one is Chourjit or Chourajit or Charajit Singh not Choroujit Singh. There are a few other petty mistakes but I'm too tired as it has been a very long post. Lastly I know Manipuri pronunciation is not very easy but atleast try to read as it is written.  Especially Lord Lainingthou Sanamahi 5:07, not Leiningandhu. Can't type Hindi otherwise I'd and it would have made more clear to you what I want to convey. If you are making a video on any place you are not familiar with it's language and you have to use some important words and names, it's best to have someone from that place to help you out. But I know you did a great deal of work to make this video and it shows in your confidence.

The root cause of this violence is the neo-colonialism of the majority community (read valley dwellers) over the tribal minorities (hill dwellers). The valley enjoys 2/3 rd of the legislative representation and thus ensuring absolute dominance over the governance, finance and distribution of wealth. The valley people have easy access to all the good things of life - abundance of food, cultivation, developments, schools, colleges, universities, hospitals, airport, city, hotels, markets etc., Because of the lack of all these in the hills, the tribals had to travel far from hills to valley to get treatment, education, jobs or sell their goods etc. If the development had happened fairly in the hills too for the 45% of the state population living there, such situation won't have arisen at the first place. So, Chanu or Kim or Pamie - all of you should learn to live and share.

From Manipur here. Even though you have covered most of the history of Manipur, you have failed to cover few key angles. Please get these right before you fuel more fire between the commuities.
1) Your assumption of neo imperialism in Manipur is utterly wrong. Meiteis never want to settle in the hills as they are not accustomed to the hills. Nor are they interested in the hill areas.  You can ask any meitei. Even if buying was allowed, the tribals will not sell their land to the meiteis (they don't even sell land to other tribes than their own). Also there are Kukis settling in the Valleys. Basically people from all the tribes are settled here.  Inner line permit do not prevent buying of land. There is a huge influx of nepalis, bangladeshis and Myanmar kukis which you will see if you were here.
And NO MEITEI own any land in the hills except the bordering areas between the valley and hills.
2) The development of the infrastructure in the hills is slow because of the corruptions amongst there own hill people. There own politicians and MLAs eat up all the money meant for hill development and blame the meiteis. There has been 2 tribal CMs. Because of ST quota, they have more government jobs than the meiteis.  There are many kukis and nagas who are richer than the meiteis. Kukis and Nagas own a huge portion of land in Imphal. 
3) It was the meiteis who ACTUALLY SAVED the kukis from nagas in 1990 kuki-naga conflict. Else you will not see them here today.
4) There intermarriages between Kukis and meiteis. They have been living in peace and harmony till the 3rd of May. 
5) Violence started in Churachandpur first ( Kuki dominated area) where they burnt forest offices and an open gym. It was when they burnt 3 villages in Torbung (in Churachanpur), that the meiteis retaliated in Imphal.
6) This conflict is related to the Drug business in which many politicians including the present CM, meitei CSOs and Kuki CSOs are involved. There was a disagreement between the Meitei drug lords and the Kuki drug lords. The CM's war against drugs was specifically targeted on the Kuki drug mafia. That is where they made it communal.

Reasons for this violence:

1) War on drugs campaign  was started by the State Government to destroy the illegal Poppy cultivation in the State . Most of the cultivation happened in the Kuki dominated areas. They earned in terms of crores from drugs business and used the money to buy sophisticated weapons from China and smuggled to Manipur via Myanmar. Those imported weapons have been using in this current conflict. The kukis were angry in the state government because they tried to destroy their drugs business. Golden Triangle has been shifting to Manipur. If we don't stand together and fight against it ,the whole country will be in jeopardize.
 
2) Eviction drive happened by the government against the land encroachers. The government evicted  villages settling in reserve forest areas illegally in Churachandpur in the hills in kuki dominated areas. The Government evicted many houses of Meiteis as well in the valley. Reserve forests areas are under the government of the state. They can't live there as per the law it's illegal. The kukis thought their community had been targeted particularly but not the other communities. Nagas houses got evicted, Meiteis houses got evicted and Meitei pangals have been evicted too, none has a problem with the Government  except Kuki community. 

3) Deforestation took place in Manipur to cultivate Poppy plants. 15400 acres of lands were  used to cultivate poppies and they cut tonnes of trees. That's why the climate has changed in Manipur, the temperature has begun to rise and environment has changed.The Government stopped deforestation to control the environment and drugs.

4) Kukis helped in bringing illegal immigrants from Myanmar to Manipur. Kukis were originally from Myanmar, they were brought to Manipur from Myanmar during British colonial. The Chin tribe of Myanmar from the Chin State are Kukis' sub-tribe. They helped the Chin people to come to Manipur illegally. These people were converted to Christian once they enter the Indian soil in Manipur. Later they issued fake id's like Aadhar cards, passports etc. Then they give them indian citizenships and enjoy all the benefits of scheduled tribes . We the Meiteis being the indigenous people of Manipur couldn't get the ST status and have been demanding for many years.

5) NRC implementation 
National register of citizens means the register containing the names of Indian citizens. Kukis were not happy with NRC cos' they were fear of losing the population. 

Kukis were not happy with the plans mentioned above made by the Government.  Since Chief Minister Mr. Biren Singh is from the Meitei community, they think Biren is favouring Meiteis and targeting them. That's why on 3rd May they started targeting Meiteis after the rally was over. They burnt Meitei houses in Churachandpur (Kuki dominated ) area completely. Horrific ethnic cleansing took place in Churachandpur and Moreh. Later at around 3pm Kuki mobs in thousands carrying guns Ak47, iron rods, sticks , petrol, catapults entered a Meitei area called Torbung and torched about 3 villages around 400 houses. Kukis want to form a separate kukiland with Mizo, Chin and kuki. So they can continue with the drug business and destroy the societies. Kukis have been playing the victim card since the violence broke out.They have forgotten that they have started the violence. 
They always tell that they minority and the majority Meiteis are treating them badly which absolutely incorrect.The image that kukis have been trying to create with lies and propagandas will not last for long. Eventually people want the truth and the truth will come out sooner.

Ethnic clashes with Kukis and other ethnic groups in Manipur:

1) Kuki Naga conflict 1992.
2) Kuki Paite ethnic clash of 1997-1998.
3) Kuki -Gorkha (minority Nepali ) kuki tortured them.
4) Kuki Meitei conflict 2023

The kukis fought with so many communities in Manipur in the past and history itself shows that Kukis always involved in violence. I am from Manipur and this is the real story.

Thanks for making the video. I want to tell you something

1. The government wants to protect the forest but  Maximum kuki sold their hill land to Myanmar kuki and they buy land in the valley

2. Non valley people get less seats in assembly because.... around 75 to 80% of the population lives in the valley. For education, job, business and all.

3. Valley land is a very small area....and maximum space is occupied for transportation roads, government offices, hospitals, schools, colleges, airport and all. That is the reason Manipur people demand for the  inner line permit.

4. For Nagas and kukis there is a huge number of seat reservations in government jobs. The government also runs many policies for free food free education free medical for tribes. So how are they poor. Tribes are not poor in Manipur, they have resources they can cultivate anywhere they can burn jungle anytime, they can sell wood anytime

4.Meiteis are poor, very poor because they don't have land for cultivation and not getting any facilities from the government because meiteis are in the general category.

5. Few Kukis are brought in Manipur earlier, so  they can be called indigenous people but in 2015 to 2023, many kuki are migrating from Myanmar and they are doing popy cultivation and building illegal houses. 

6. The present Government tried to stop poppy cultivation in hill areas and drug business, suddenly kuki people attacked the meitei community.

7. In Manipur there are no stereotypes of tribals, all are similar all sit together and eat together. There is no racism, partiality, untouched system etc. 

8. The Supreme court approved Meiteis inclusion in ST.  Because Meiteis also ST before Gouranga religion is not adopted. Once the king of Manipur adopted Gouranga Prabhu, he declared that all persons should be suffix Singh(for male) and Devi ( for females) as the symbols of acceptance of Hindu dharma. In the late period of 19 centuries Manipur was included in the Indian constitution. But outsiders don't know the culture, tradition, or ethnics of Manipur. And automatically the Indian constitution considers all Meiteis are General cast. 

Meiteis are not general cast and Kuki, Nagas are also not SC or ST. we all are OBC. From the beginning we have the same cast.  If Nagas and kukis are ST then Meitei should be ST. Otherwise all should be general.

A few kuki people are very angry at the Government because the government stopped poppy cultivation in Churachandpur, so they started war from the 27th April and in the name of peace rally kuki attacked the' Meitei community on 3rd May,23.

All crisis and war is about immigrants Chin Kuki, drug business, poppy cultivation.

First of all, thank you @Dhruv Rathee  for making this informative video on the burning issue of Manipur. You have presented us the facts very well through an indepth analysis. However, to cover a larger portion of facts please consider the following points also in your next video. 
1. The present day valley people have had deep-rooted connections with the surrounding hills since time immemorial and this can be understood from the ancient names of various hills like Koubru, Thangjing, Nongmaijing, etc. Hence, these hills represent  ancient cultural memories for the valley people  which many of the newly settled hill tribes may not share.
2. The idea of hill/plain binary is quite a complex one in the context of the people of Manipur as the ancestors of the plain people of today were mostly the hill tribes themselves. Hence, hills and plain people have the same root which is exemplified by their languages (Tibeto-Burman family), food habits, dress codes, folk stories and so on. 
3. One way to look at people's connection to their surrounding geographical space is to appreciate their ancient creation myths. Kindly compare and do a side-by-side analysis of creation myths of the Meiteis and the Kukis to understand their connections with Manipur. 
4. Economic disparity and crime are closely connected. In Manipur, it needs to be seen how lands are exploited and profits earned through illegal drug cultivation. Drugs are harmful for the whole mankind, not just plain people or the hill people. Please focus on the roles of people of the state in ending the drug  menace.

What then is the solution for this long standing strife? It does not appear that these tribes are stable enough to govern themselves. As is evident from the video, Manipur in particular and the NE in general has had a long history of inter tribal wars. Despite the troubled history Manipur was included as part of India for some inexplicable reason. Sorry to be blunt here, but when the various tribes fighting for greater autonomy are constantly at each other's throats since decades, not surprised why the past and present Indian govt has been reluctant to give more autonomy. Also not surprised why the media and the population of the rest of India did not pay much heed to the violence that broke out until the horrific video from Manipur went viral recently. The present govt with its penchant for thriving on any strife and conflict has expectedly let Manipur boil and exploited the inter mingled ethnicity of the kuki-zomi, naga and meitei communities. Add a mixture of religions (sanamahism, christianity, Islam, Hinduism, animism etc) to the cocktail and it is no wonder the hill state is burning. 

The younger generation of north easterners complain of 'racism' when they live in Indian metros. But puzzlingly, back home the attitude of their communities towards tribes who share ethnicity with them is extremely hostile and bloody. Indeed ironical. 

Preservation of tribal customs seems laudable on paper. But providing healthcare facilities to tribes leading a pastoral life living in remote forest areas is a great challenge for any govt. Without building roads and hospitals how can the govt take care of people during a health emergency or of pregnant women who deserve a safe delivery? If people die for want of modern facilities then too the govt will be heavily criticised regardless of who it is. 

Tribal communities in general see modern education as a threat to their ancient customs and cultural identity. But hanging onto those also deprives communities from more lucrative economic opportunities other agriculture or cattle rearing, fishing or handicraft making. Strangely the educated folk from the NE, active on the internet having tribal origins, reside in metro cities all the while vociferously demanding that indigenous culture back home be preserved. This dissonance is rather puzzling. If the younger generation leaves the hills and settles in the plains it is but natural for them to adopt a non traditional profession and consequently a non traditional lifestyle. As more and more younger folk do so, how can "traditional customs" and way of life be preserved? 

 Inner line permit, Article 371, 6th schedule, HAC, ADC, Kukiland, ST status etc cannot guarantee peace and progress in the NE because each of the communities want political power, land, parliamentary representation, stronger ties with the rest of India but will not honestly acknowledge problems in each of their mindset and practices. After watching this video I feel quite sure that meeting current demands in a manner satisfactory to all is no longer possible and even if some consensus is arrived at, it will not be long before new demands for "greater autonomy" or some recognition or other will arise from the area. People of the NE have a lot to reflect on. An unfortunate situation is not only the doing of external factors.

The political landscape thrives on sowing hatred and intolerance towards those practicing different religions, all in an unapologetic pursuit of power and exploitation. This cycle of power-seeking wheel spinning on the fuel called hate  breeds greater cruelty and horror with each turn. I came to realize this in due time, recognizing that we're on a relentless path towards the erosion and destruction of India's once-exemplary unity amid remarkable diversity. The poison of hate won't halt at religious divisions alone, extending its reach to deeper divides: social, regional, and caste-based, which we are already witnessing. The faith in hate will cut deeper and farther- forward backward, Hindu Sikh, upper caste and lower caste, Dalit non Dalit, North Indian South Indian, East Indian North Indian, and so on and so forth.

It's not my intention to pass judgment on any particular political party, as they all share blame for the deliberate and calculated dismantling of our nation, driven by self-interest, and greed for more power to torment more

However, the ruling party bears the weight of responsibility for not curbing these destructive tendencies and for actively propagating malevolence in society. What's even more disgraceful is their insincere displays of sympathy, which only worsens the wounds of those displaced and affected by ethnic conflicts - thousands of them with completely ruined lives. No nation has ever become great standing on corpses of innocent lives - sadly lessons of history are seldom learnt.

The time has come to expose and remove the politicians who foster greed and promote hatred, banishing them from their positions of power.

Some wrong facts put up deliberately or unknowingly put up by Sir Dhruv:
1) At 26:30 minute, the Tribals said that Meiteis (Valley Dwellers) have ILP. THAT'S wrong, ILP is applied to the current whole territory of Manipur, not only to the Valley. 

2) 26:54, According to KNO, MEITEIs did not help Kukis in 1993 Naga-Kuki Conflict. This is absolutely wrong. There are so so many photos and videos still, helping those kukis running for life from the hills, giving food and shelter in the Imphal Valley areas by meiteis against the nagas. Even Nagas are still angry at Meiteis for giving help to kukis that time. Ask any naga Or meitei, you will know. This clearly shows that you have taken the informations of this conflict only from kuki's side, not a single info from meiteis. 

3) 26:04, you said jungles are home of tribals. Meiteis are worshippers of forest and trees since ancient times. But Kukis planted poppy, degrading soil quality and destroying forests, even encroached the protected forest areas often. 

4) 27:20, kukis were demanding separate state. Look at the letter sent by kukis to UN recently. There they demand for separate country, merging chin state from myanmar, chittagong hill tracks from Bangladesh, mizoram and Kuki residing areas of Manipur.

NB: Don't turn a blind eye to Meiteis, due to your hatred of BJP. Stand for the Truth sir. Keep up your ethical values for Truth.

With the partition of Burma from India in 1039, the line became the India and Burma boundary. This boundary effectively divided the Kuki/Zo tribes, one in Burma and the other in India. In addition, the ceding of chittagong Hill Tracts-parts of Zo/kuki country to East Pakistan (Bangladesh) again. Thus, The zo/kuki ( the so called chin kuki lushai by the outsiders) tribes and their ancestral land was fragmented and appended to three Independent counties - India, Burma and Bangladesh. Thus, one part of Indian Zo/kuki people and country went to Assam ( now forming Mizoram state), one part went to Manipur state ( Now forming Churachanpur and Chandel district and Sadel Hills), other part went to tripura, and Assam, and another part went to Pakistan( Now forming Bangladesh) While the Burmese part form the Chin State and part of Arakan, Magwe & Sangang Division.
CI.E.B.Elly. Asst Quarter Master General.

Please dont rush in making a video about Manipur. Do an indepth research.
1. First, Meitei has total population of 17 lakhs in the world. That's less than an UP or Bihar's district. That's why we need the constitutional protection. 
2. Meitei Kingdom, so called Kangleipak, is an ancient kingdom and all the tribal chiefs living in the hills were aswerable to the Meitei Kings and there are recorded historical account where various tribes were seen helping the meitei king in times of war.
3. British when passing through Manipur they were constantly attacked by Naga tribes. So, they brought Kuki tribes for the first time in Manipur in 1850's, settle them hills of Manipur to create a buffer zone and  protect themselves from the Naga attacks.
These are some accurate information relating to multiple written records. I can go on and on but you know, you get the jist.

The 200 year old migration you are referring about is of New Kuki (includes Thadou tribe among others). However there were other Kuki groups that were migrated around 16/17th century that includes Sukte, Simte, Chhothe tribes etc. They are known as old kuki. 
Further there are tribal group like Moyons and Monsang, who now identifies as Naga tribe for socio-political reasons. But they are closer to Kuki tribe instead. They have been original habitant of Manipur. As old as Meiteis.

MANIPUR SITUATION IN SHORT - More than 90 days passed. No effective measure to contain the violence. Death 182+,missing 17+,person with bullet injury 200+,displaced people 70,000+, people on relief camp 50,000+, houses burnt 40,000+. 

Root cause - 1. Narco Terrorism and 2. Illegal immigrants. Helped by leaders with vested interest.  Worst part - kuki militants use Snipers, drones, land mines, vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) etc. Sophisticated weapons coming from Myanmar to attack meiteis at foothills area, that even Indian army don't use.

Started from kuki dominated area Churchandpur on 27 April destroyed New Gym Centre to be anaugurated by CM. 28 April, all CCTV of entire town demolished to falsify evidence. 3rd May,2023 - 12+ churchandpur localities of meiteis and localities of Moreh meitei completely wiped out(ethnic cleansing).

Land reforms act 1960. Exclusion of hilly(tribal) status of meitei in 1949 when Manipur merged with Indian union, because of that  meitei can not buy land in hilly areas and also in valley that is once owned by tribal. Meetei population 52% live in only 7% land including all other communities. Finally, meitei's would probably become kasmere pandit.

Kuki militants are very powerful now with drug money and church support internationally. It's a national security threat. Mizoram in support. They get help from Myanmar, Bangladesh cos of ethnic relationships. They want a kuki land taking a part of India, Bangladesh, Myanmar. It's a clash between - "Indigenous and non-Indigenous". Meitei's have 2000+ year old Indigenous culture and civilization whereas Kuki's don't.

No one talks of burning many 200 years old Meitei Temples(Mandirs). 4 churches are burnt by kuki only. 250 + Churches burnt were of meitei's only, that nobody mentioned. Many Meitei pastor houses were burnt in Churchandpur.

Where is "Linthoingambi"(a 17 year old meitei girl from Tera, missing)? Can anyone answer? A meitei grandmother Sorokhaibam Ibetombi(80) was "BURNT ALIVE" in Serou, that nobody talks about. This the obviously, the worst violence that the nation has ever faced. Everyone should look at both sides and the details.

Couple of facts - 1. Who carries gun AK47 on peace rally ?
2. At 2.15pm imp office building burnt on 3rd May in ccpur.
3. By 3.43pm houses at boljang and torbung started burning. Hearing the news, meteis reacted by late evening after 9pm and 4May.

5 questions 
1. Why did kuki militants forced civilians to buy guns for every household in kuki dominated areas, the last 1 to 2 years?
2. Why was the CCTV cameras vandalized on 28th April, 2023 for entire Churchandpur town, before big event 3 rd May, 2023?
3. Why maximum Kuki's were on leave starting last week of April 2023 working in the valley?
4. If kuki want separate administration, why not approach the right authority through legal procedure instead of violence(burning houses & ethnic cleansing of meiteis)?

Great analysis Dhruv.
I follow your channels but there is some fundamental mistake and some not mentioned which are very pertinent to this issue.
1. British dominace in hills being incomplete will be wrong as they have been mass converted to Chritianity by British.

2. Meitei in Myanmar are not captured meitei, but for many years kabow valley in present day Myanmar which was donated by Pandit Nehru was a part of Manipur till Chindwin river which meitei called it as Ningthi turel.
Moreover intermarriage between Myanmar king and that of Meitei also happened. 

3. Meitei kingdom expand till Ahom in Assam and Tripura kingdom that's why u will see meitei king and queen rolling Tripura evident in museum of Tripura.

4. As far fencing is concern, it would be wrong to say that it will cut all ties with neighbouring country, as in present day condition there are 6 highways which connect Manipur with Myanmar and only one through Moreh is manned, rest are porous even though proper routes are there that's shows the laxity of border security. 

5. Dhruv you also have failed to stressed that 10% of Manipur which is only 6% habitable any Indian can buy, settle and do business but valley people can't buy or own property in any so called hill (90%) in his own state.

6. Nomadic and semi nomadic nature of tribals are hangover concept which doesn't happen now especially in Manipur which I can bout for. 

7. Manipur is not rest of India with limited connectivity, no industries, railway and their is no stark difference between hills and valley people as far as monetary is concerned. 
Rather some of the richest people in Manipur the malls and private hospitals are owned by tribals living in Imphal Valley. 

8. When Meitei king signed merger agreement with Indian subcontinent in Oct 4, 1949, the area merged was 18,000 Sq miles which is more than 46,619 Sq km. However the present area of Manipur is hardly 22,327 Sq km.

Apart from this the research and analysis was good but little skewed nature of analysis can be perceived which I am sure you will rectify in your subsequent parts.

MANIPUR SITUATION IN SHORT - More than 90 days passed. No effective measure to contain the violence. Death 182+,missing 17+,rape case 10+,person with bullet injury 200+,displaced people 70,000+, people on relief camp 50,000+, houses burnt 40,000+. 

Root cause - 1. Narco Terrorism and 2. Illegal immigrants. Helped by leaders with vested interest.  Worst part - kuki militants use Snipers, drones, land mines, vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) etc. Sophisticated weapons coming from Myanmar to attack meiteis at foothills area, that even Indian army don't use.

Started from kuki dominated area Churchandpur on 27 April destroyed New Gym Centre to be anaugurated by CM. 28 April, all CCTV of entire town demolished to falsify evidence. 3rd May,2023 - 12+ churchandpur localities of meiteis and localities of Moreh meitei completely wiped out(ethnic cleansing).

Land reforms act 1960. Exclusion of hilly(tribal) status of meitei in 1949 when Manipur merged with Indian union, because of that  meitei can not buy land in hilly areas and also in valley that is once owned by tribal. Meetei population 52% live in only 7% land including all other communities. Finally, meitei's would probably become kasmere pandit.

Kuki militants are very powerful now with drug money and church support internationally. It's a national security threat. Mizoram in support. They get help from Myanmar, Bangladesh cos of ethnic relationships. They want a kuki land taking a part of India, Bangladesh, Myanmar. It's a clash between - "Indigenous and non-Indigenous". Meitei's have 2000+ year old Indigenous culture and civilization whereas Kuki's don't.

No one talks of burning many 200 years old Meitei Temples(Mandirs). 4 churches are burnt by kuki only. 250 + Churches burnt were of meitei's only, that nobody mentioned. Many Meitei pastor houses were burnt in Churchandpur.

Where is "Linthoingambi"(a 17 year old meitei girl from Tera, missing)? Can anyone answer? A meitei grandmother Sorokhaibam Ibetombi(80) was "BURNT ALIVE" in Serou, that nobody talks about. This the obviously, the worst violence that the nation has ever faced. Everyone should look at both sides and the details.

Couple of facts - 1. Who carries gun AK47 on peace rally ?
2. At 2.15pm imp office building burnt on 3rd May in ccpur.
3. By 3.43pm houses at boljang and torbung started burning. Hearing the news, meteis reacted by late evening after 9pm and 4May.

5 questions 
1. Why did kuki militants forced civilians to buy guns for every household in kuki dominated areas, the last 1 to 2 years?
2. Why was the CCTV cameras vandalized on 28th April, 2023 for entire Churchandpur town, before big event 3 rd May, 2023?
3. Why maximum Kuki's were on leave starting last week of April 2023 working in the valley?
4. If kuki want separate administration, why not approach the right authority through legal procedure instead of violence(burning houses & ethnic cleansing of meiteis)?
5. Why they use Zomi Revolutionary Army flag in last rally, are they still Indian?

I am sure, everyone is sensible enough to understand the facts, if it was a well planned or not. "Facts never lie". 3rd May was just an excuse.

Central government hasn't done anything yet to contain the violence. Letting people to kill each other. People of Manipur are dying in extremely worst situation. Get facts on both sides. Let there be justice and punish culprits on both sides.

Solution - 1. Revoke SOO 2. Pass NRC 3. Build strong border 4. Restore Meitei Tribal status to equalize land issue 5. Improve VDF to protect foothill villages.

Thanks for telling us whole history about Manipur! Indeed great video, waiting for part 2!!

MANIPUR SITUATION IN SHORT - More than 90 days passed. No effective measure to contain the violence. Death 182+,missing 17+,person with bullet injury 200+,displaced people 70,000+, people on relief camp 50,000+, houses burnt 40,000+. 

Root cause - 1. Narco Terrorism and 2. Illegal immigrants. Helped by leaders with vested interest.  Worst part - kuki militants use Snipers, drones, land mines, vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) etc. Sophisticated weapons coming from Myanmar to attack meiteis at foothills area, that even Indian army don't use.

Started from kuki dominated area Churchandpur on 27 April destroyed New Gym Centre to be anaugurated by CM. 28 April, all CCTV of entire town demolished to falsify evidence. 3rd May,2023 - 12+ churchandpur localities of meiteis and localities of Moreh meitei completely wiped out(ethnic cleansing).

Land reforms act 1960. Exclusion of hilly(tribal) status of meitei in 1949 when Manipur merged with Indian union, because of that  meitei can not buy land in hilly areas and also in valley that is once owned by tribal. Meetei population 52% live in only 7% land including all other communities. Finally, meitei's would probably become kasmere pandit.

Kuki militants are very powerful now with drug money and church support internationally. It's a national security threat. Mizoram in support. They get help from Myanmar, Bangladesh cos of ethnic relationships. They want a kuki land taking a part of India, Bangladesh, Myanmar. It's a clash between - "Indigenous and non-Indigenous". Meitei's have 2000+ year old Indigenous culture and civilization whereas Kuki's don't.

No one talks of burning many 200 years old Meitei Temples(Mandirs). 4 churches are burnt by kuki only. 250 + Churches burnt were of meitei's only, that nobody mentioned. Many Meitei pastor houses were burnt in Churchandpur.

Where is "Linthoingambi"(a 17 year old meitei girl from Tera, missing)? Can anyone answer? A meitei grandmother Sorokhaibam Ibetombi(80) was "BURNT ALIVE" in Serou, that nobody talks about. This the obviously, the worst violence that the nation has ever faced. Everyone should look at both sides and the details.

Couple of facts - 1. Who carries gun AK47 on peace rally ?
2. At 2.15pm imp office building burnt on 3rd May in ccpur.
3. By 3.43pm houses at boljang and torbung started burning. Hearing the news, meteis reacted by late evening after 9pm and 4May.

5 questions 
1. Why did kuki militants forced civilians to buy guns for every household in kuki dominated areas, the last 1 to 2 years?
2. Why was the CCTV cameras vandalized on 28th April, 2023 for entire Churchandpur town, before big event 3 rd May, 2023?
3. Why maximum Kuki's were on leave starting last week of April 2023 working in the valley?
4. If kuki want separate administration, why not approach the right authority through legal procedure instead of violence(burning houses & ethnic cleansing of meiteis)?
5. Why they use Zomi Revolutionary Army flag in last rally, are they still Indian?

I am sure, everyone is sensible enough to understand the facts, if it was a well planned or not. "Facts never lie". 3rd May was just an excuse.

Central government hasn't done anything yet to contain the violence. Letting people to kill each other. People of Manipur are dying in extremely worst situation. Get facts on both sides. Let there be justice and punish culprits on both sides.

Solution - 1. Revoke SOO 2. Pass NRC 3. Build strong border 4. Restore Meitei Tribal status to equalize land issue 5. Improve VDF to protect foothill villages.
Let's hope for peace in Manipur. Long live Manipur. Manipurgi saktam Kaiba yaroi.

My fav history teacher тЭд

Mr Rathi still your understanding to Manipur, Naga, Meitei & Kuki are little bit weak. 

1. You confused yourself & the listeners too by adding the word "Naga army in Ahom dynasty"
Plz refer "Simon Commission" to clear your confusion regarding the origin of Naga & Nagaland state. 
Naga evolves in Ahom kingdom since 1860. But Naganization happened in Manipur in late 1980s.After 1980 Naga start existence in Manipur. So your understanding regarding Naga army in Ahom dynasty was no where related to Meitei kingdom. 

2. Kukis were imported in late 17th century in Manipur. 

3. All the Naga & kuki were under Meitei king. They paid taxes (Loipot in pure Manipuri word) to the king. 

4. Current war is about Land, Drugs, Terrorist & Myanmarese Or nothing else. 

5. Thought 10% land is in Valley, there is also a lake called Loktak inside the valley. So usable land is only 4%

6. Current assembly seats are
     Meitei - 34
     Kuki     - 10
     Naga   -  10
     Nepali  - 01
     Muslim  05
Out of 60 seat 40 seat of MLA 02 seats for MP (LS) are kept unreserved (can be contested by everyone) & 20 seats for MLA 01 seat for MP (RS) are permanently reserved for Kuki & Naga. Tribes lost seat in valley even thought most of them are migrated to valley & permanently settle there because they scattered everywhere. These makes meitei win in valley. 

7. Meitei are not permited to settle in hills

Your explanation is very confusing. Clarity is missing these days

MANIPUR SITUATION IN SHORT - More than 90 days passed. No effective measure to contain the violence. Death 182+,missing 17+,rape case 10+,person with bullet injury 200+,displaced people 70,000+, people on relief camp 50,000+, houses burnt 40,000+. 

Root cause - 1. Narco Terrorism and 2. Illegal immigrants. Helped by leaders with vested interest.  Worst part - kuki militants use Snipers, drones, land mines, vehicle-borne improvised explosive device (VBIED) etc. Sophisticated weapons coming from Myanmar to attack meiteis at foothills area, that even Indian army don't use.

Started from kuki dominated area Churchandpur on 27 April destroyed New Gym Centre to be anaugurated by CM. 28 April, all CCTV of entire town demolished to falsify evidence. 3rd May,2023 - 12+ churchandpur localities of meiteis and localities of Moreh meitei completely wiped out(ethnic cleansing).

Land reforms act 1960. Exclusion of hilly(tribal) status of meitei in 1949 when Manipur merged with Indian union, because of that  meitei can not buy land in hilly areas and also in valley that is once owned by tribal. Meetei population 52% live in only 7% land including all other communities. Finally, meitei's would probably become kasmere pandit.

Kuki militants are very powerful now with drug money and church support internationally. It's a national security threat. Mizoram in support. They get help from Myanmar, Bangladesh cos of ethnic relationships. They want a kuki land taking a part of India, Bangladesh, Myanmar. It's a clash between - "Indigenous and non-Indigenous". Meitei's have 2000+ year old Indigenous culture and civilization whereas Kuki's don't.

No one talks of burning many 200 years old Meitei Temples(Mandirs). 4 churches are burnt by kuki only. 250 + Churches burnt were of meitei's only, that nobody mentioned. Many Meitei pastor houses were burnt in Churchandpur.

Where is "Linthoingambi"(a 17 year old meitei girl from Tera, missing)? Can anyone answer? A meitei grandmother Sorokhaibam Ibetombi(80) was "BURNT ALIVE" in Serou, that nobody talks about. This the obviously, the worst violence that the nation has ever faced. Everyone should look at both sides and the details.

Couple of facts - 1. Who carries gun AK47 on peace rally ?
2. At 2.15pm imp office building burnt on 3rd May in ccpur.
3. By 3.43pm houses at boljang and torbung started burning. Hearing the news, meteis reacted by late evening after 9pm and 4May.

5 questions 
1. Why did kuki militants forced civilians to buy guns for every household in kuki dominated areas, the last 1 to 2 years?
2. Why was the CCTV cameras vandalized on 28th April, 2023 for entire Churchandpur town, before big event 3 rd May, 2023?
3. Why maximum Kuki's were on leave starting last week of April 2023 working in the valley?
4. If kuki want separate administration, why not approach the right authority through legal procedure instead of violence(burning houses & ethnic cleansing of meiteis)?
5. Why they use Zomi Revolutionary Army flag in last rally, are they still Indian?

I am sure, everyone is sensible enough to understand the facts, if it was a well planned or not. "Facts never lie". 3rd May was just an excuse.

Central government hasn't done anything yet to contain the violence. Letting people to kill each other. People of Manipur are dying in extremely worst situation. Get facts on both sides. Let there be justice and punish culprits on both sides.

Solution - 1. Revoke SOO 2. Pass NRC 3. Build strong border 4. Restore Meitei Tribal status to equalize land issue 5. Improve VDF to protect foothill villages.

Hello Dhruv, I'm from Manipur. I hope you read this comment. I have been following you for almost 3,4 years now and I really like your approach and opinions you share on this channel. You make videos mostly on burning issues about the country, the world, from history to the Indian economy, politics etc. Sometimes I find that you make videos on timetravel, conspiracies, myth too. When you make such videos I would think to myself that you must be out of current issues and that you started looking for other topics. Today I see that you are making a video of my own home state. I'm sorry that the first video you make of my home state is not about something extraordinary and remarkable the state has done, which I as a resident of the state and as your long-term follower, would be proud of, but rather about a dark, disgusting, barbaric and inhumane phase of the state. I haven't watch this video of yours because I'm nervous of what your opinion could be and mostly because I don't want to listen to you narrating the previous incidents that had happened and re-live those gruesome moments again. I will watch it someday when everything's normal, when peace is restored and both the communities hug, console, forgive and most importantly start loving each other again.
